newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares end mixed, turn back from firm start.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares end mixed, turn back from firm start.

text.p: Greek equities failed to capitalise on a promising start on Thursday and met with resistance near 1,600-points, finishing 0.07 percent lower.
"Approaching the 1,600 level triggered sales in blue chips, especially banks, which could not be cushioned by current low turnover levels," said George Politis, a broker at EuroSec.
"Large institutional players are side-lined at this period because they have sensed a lack of momentum to push past the 1,600 barrier," he added.
The Athens general index slipped 0.07 percent or 1.03 points to 1,575.30 from Wednesday's 1,576.33 close, turning back from an intra-day high of 1,593.89.
Sector sub-indices gave a mixed view, with banks closing 0.09 lower and industrials adding 0.19 percent.
Turnover amounted to 11.9 billion drachmas on volume of 2.6 million shares.
A block of 50,000 shares of Alpha Leasing was put through at 7,395/7,425 drachmas.
Declinerss beat advances 130 to 79 with 18 shares unchanged on 227 traded.
OTE telecom Global Depository Shares (GDS) were quoted on London's SEAQ International market at $11.50-$11.80. Two GDSs make up one share of OTE.
